markdown.markdown:
#### [Collaboration and Team Science: A Field Guide](\pdfs\TeamScienceFieldGuide.pdf){target="_blank"} ("Team Science Field Guide" in weekly readings) #### Dare to Lead (hard copy provided to all students; "DtL" in weekly readings) #### [Dare to Lead Workbook](\pdfs\DTLWorkbook.pdf){target="_blank"} ("DtL Workbook" in weekly assignments) ## Weekly Reading and Assignments ```{r} #| echo: false #| warning: false #| message: false package.list <- c('gt', 'tidyverse') ## Installing them if they aren't already on the computer new.packages <- package.list[!(package.list %in% installed.packages()[,"Package"])] if(length(new.packages)) install.packages(new.packages) ## And loading them for(i in package.list){library(i, character.only = T)} tibble( Week = c("1", "", "2", "", "3", ""), Day = c("8/29", "8/31", "9/5", "9/7", "9/12", "9/14"), Reading = c("Cheruvelil & Soranno 2018_DtL: Intro and Part 1, Section 1_(pages 1-43)", "", "Team Science Field Guide: pages iii-3_ Cheruvelil et al. 2014", "", "DtL: Part 1, Sections 2-3_(pages 44-177)", "Team Science Field Guide: pages 5-19"), Assignment = c("DtL Workbook:_Section 1, Exercise 1_Section 1, Exercise 2", "Elevator Pitch", "", "True Colors Assessment", 'DtL Workbook:_Section 2, Exercise 1_Section 2, Exercise 4', 'Myers Briggs Assessment') ) %>% mutate(Reading = str_replace_all(Reading, "_", "
"), Assignment = str_replace_all(Assignment, "_", "
")) %>% mutate(Reading = map(Reading, gt::html), Assignment = map(Assignment, gt::html)) %>% gt() %>% tab_options(table.font.size = 20, column_labels.font.weight = 'bold', column_labels.font.size = 20) %>% opt_horizontal_padding(scale = 3) %>% cols_align(align = c("left"), columns = everything() )%>% fmt_markdown(columns = TRUE) ```
